services.geolocationNotSupported: Geolocation is not supported by your browser

reviews.beFirst: Be the first to review this service
reviews.reviewPlaceholder: Share your experience with this service...
reviews.signInToReview: Sign in to leave a review
reviews.alreadyReviewed: You have already reviewed this service

account.title: Account
account.enableBusinessDesc: Add and manage your own services, get statistics, and reach more customers
account.businessConfirmBody: Business accounts unlock tools for promoting services and reaching more clients. Do you want to switch to a Business Account?
account.businessSuccessBody: Congratulations! Your account has been successfully upgraded. You can now add services and grow your client base.
account.myServicesDesc: View and manage your service listings
account.statisticsDesc: View performance metrics for your services

addService.title: Add Service
addService.tierDescription: Choose your plan. All plans start with a 14-day free trial.
addService.tierDescriptionNew: Choose your plan. Standard is always free, Premium includes a one-time 14-day trial.
addService.standardFeatures: Basic listing with all essential features
addService.topFeatures: Premium listing with enhanced visibility and top placement
addService.trialNote: 14-day free trial included. You'll be charged after the trial ends.
addService.premiumTrialUsed: Premium trial already used. Payment required for new premium listings.
addService.premiumTrialInfo: You get a one-time 14-day free trial for your first premium service.
addService.premiumPaymentInfo: Your trial has been used. Payment will be required to create this premium listing.
addService.paymentError: Failed to initiate payment. Please try again.
addService.standardFreeNote: Standard listings are always free - no payment required.
addService.standardServiceAdded: Standard service added successfully! It is now active.
addService.serviceAdded: Service added successfully! Your 14-day trial ends on {date}.
addService.failed: Failed to add service. Please try again.
addService.availableLanguagesDesc: Select the languages your service is available in
addService.trialUsed: You have already used your free trial for this plan. Payment required.
addService.paymentRequired: Trial not available for selected plan. Payment will be required.
addService.locationDescription: Help customers find you with accurate location details
addService.postcodeHint: Enter a valid UK postcode (e.g., SW1A 1AA or E11)
addService.addressHint: Optional - for display only, does not affect search
addService.locationSet: Location coordinates will be set automatically

validation.postcodeRequired: Please enter a valid UK postcode
validation.postcodeInvalid: Invalid UK postcode format. Use format like SW1A 1AA or E11

myServices.title: My Services
myServices.noServices: You haven't added any services yet
myServices.deleteServiceMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this service? This action cannot be undone.
myServices.moderationMessage: This service has been suspended due to multiple reports. Editing, deletion, and re-publishing are disabled.
myServices.actionDisabledModeration: Action disabled while service is under moderation

editService.failed: Failed to update service. Please try again.
editService.alreadyPremium: You are already on the Premium plan. Downgrading is not available.
editService.upgradeInfo: Clicking upgrade will redirect you to complete payment first.
editService.upgradeError: Failed to initiate upgrade. Please try again.

accountType.title: Choose Your Account Type
accountType.subtitle: Select the type of account you want to create
accountType.regularDesc: Access all information and guides for living in the UK
accountType.businessDesc: Offer services and connect with clients

messages.aboutInfo: A simple assistant for migrants living in the UK
messages.feedbackInfo: Thank you for your interest! Feedback feature coming soon.
messages.proDescription: Get full access to advanced guides including Jobs, Housing, Benefits, and Education.

ads.title: Advertising
ads.accountDesc: Promote your business in the app
ads.promoteDescription: Reach thousands of users with targeted ads in our services feed
ads.noAds: You don't have any ads yet
ads.mediaRequirements: Photo: JPG/PNG/WebP, 16:9 ratio, max 5MB. Video: MP4/WebM, max 5 sec, 16:9 ratio, max 10MB
ads.clickToUpload: Click to upload photo or video
ads.targetUrlHint: Where users will be directed when they click your ad
ads.languagesHint: Select which languages your ad targets
ads.pricingInfo: 7-day FREE trial. After trial: Â£7.99/month to keep your ad active.
ads.invalidPhotoType: Only JPG, PNG, and WebP images are allowed
ads.invalidVideoType: Only MP4 and WebM videos are allowed
ads.videoTooLong: Video must be 5 seconds or less
ads.adCreatedDesc: Your ad is now active with a 7-day free trial
ads.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this ad? This action cannot be undone.
ads.paymentSuccess: Payment successful! Your ad is now extended.

nin.title: National Insurance Number (NIN)
nin.need2: Proof of address in the UK
nin.need3: Right to work in the UK
nin.step1: Call the National Insurance number application line: 0800 141 2075
nin.step2: Answer questions about your identity and immigration status
nin.step3: Attend an interview at a Jobcentre if required
nin.step4: Receive your NIN by post within 4-6 weeks
nin.warning1: You can start working before receiving your NIN
nin.warning2: Keep your NIN safe - you'll need it for life

bank.title: Bank Account
bank.need2: Proof of address (utility bill, tenancy agreement)
bank.step1: Choose a bank (Monzo, Starling are easier for newcomers)
bank.step2: Apply online or visit a branch
bank.step4: Receive your card within 5-7 working days
bank.warning1: Some banks require proof of address which can be difficult for newcomers
bank.warning2: Digital banks (Monzo, Starling, Revolut) often have easier requirements
bank.warning3: You may need an initial deposit

brp.title: Biometric Residence Permit (BRP)
brp.step2: Receive decision letter with BRP collection details
brp.step3: Collect your BRP from the designated Post Office within 10 days
brp.step4: Check all details on your BRP are correct
brp.warning1: Collect your BRP within 10 days of arriving or your visa start date
brp.warning2: Report any errors on your BRP immediately
brp.warning3: Keep your BRP safe - it's your proof of right to live in the UK
brp.warning4: BRPs are being phased out - check if you need an eVisa instead

gp.title: GP Registration
gp.step1: Find a GP surgery near you on NHS.uk
gp.step2: Check if the surgery is accepting new patients
gp.warning1: You don't need proof of address or immigration status to register
gp.warning3: You can register even if you don't have a fixed address

councilTax.title: Council Tax Registration
councilTax.need1: Tenancy agreement or proof of property ownership
councilTax.need3: Personal details of all adults in the property
councilTax.step2: Register for Council Tax online or by phone
councilTax.step3: Provide details of your property and household
councilTax.step4: Set up payment method (monthly direct debit recommended)
councilTax.warning1: Council Tax is a legal requirement - you must register
councilTax.warning2: Students may be exempt - check your council's rules
councilTax.warning3: Single person? You may get 25% discount

drivingLicence.title: UK Driving Licence
drivingLicence.step1: Check if you can exchange your licence or need to take a test
drivingLicence.step4: Receive your UK licence within 3 weeks
drivingLicence.warning1: Some countries' licences can be exchanged directly
drivingLicence.warning2: Others require you to pass UK driving tests
drivingLicence.warning3: You can drive on a foreign licence for 12 months
drivingLicence.warning4: After 12 months you must have a UK licence

findGp.title: Find a GP Near You
findGp.content1: A GP (General Practitioner) is your primary healthcare provider in the UK.
findGp.content2: They handle most health issues and refer you to specialists if needed.
findGp.content3: Finding a good GP near your home is essential for accessing NHS services.
findGp.step1: Visit NHS.uk and use the 'Find a GP' service
findGp.step2: Enter your postcode to see nearby surgeries
findGp.step3: Check surgery reviews and opening hours
findGp.step4: Call to check if they're accepting new patients

register.title: Register with a GP
register.content1: Registering with a GP is free and everyone in England can register.
register.content2: You do NOT need proof of address or immigration status.
register.content3: Once registered, you can book appointments and access NHS services.
register.step1: Find a GP surgery near you
register.step2: Get the GMS1 form (available at surgery or online)
register.step4: Submit the form at the surgery

free.title: Free NHS Services
free.content2: Hospital treatment is free for emergencies
free.content3: Maternity care is free for all
free.content4: Treatment for certain infectious diseases is free
free.content6: Prescriptions may have a charge (currently Â£9.90 per item in England)
free.content7: Dental care has NHS charges but is cheaper than private
free.content8: Eye tests are free for certain groups
free.content9: Many services are free for low-income families

emergency.title: Emergency Care
emergency.content1: Call 999 for life-threatening emergencies (heart attack, stroke, serious injury)
emergency.content2: Call 111 for urgent but non-life-threatening issues
emergency.content3: A&E (Accident & Emergency) is for serious injuries and conditions
emergency.content4: Minor Injuries Units handle less serious issues
emergency.content5: Walk-in centres are available for minor illnesses without appointment

nhsNumber.title: Your NHS Number
nhsNumber.content1: Your NHS number is a 10-digit number unique to you
nhsNumber.content2: It helps the NHS identify you and access your records
nhsNumber.content3: You get an NHS number when you first register with a GP
nhsNumber.content4: You can find your NHS number on prescriptions
nhsNumber.content5: It's also on your medical letters
nhsNumber.content6: You can find it through the NHS App
nhsNumber.content7: Or by asking your GP surgery
nhsNumber.content8: Keep your NHS number safe and share it when accessing healthcare

cvWriting.title: CV Writing
cvWriting.content1: A UK CV is typically 2 pages maximum
cvWriting.content2: Include personal details: name, phone, email, location
cvWriting.content3: Write a brief personal statement (3-4 sentences about your skills)
cvWriting.content4: List work experience in reverse chronological order
cvWriting.content5: Include company name, job title, dates, and key achievements
cvWriting.content7: Quantify achievements where possible (e.g., 'Increased sales by 20%')
cvWriting.content10: Don't include: photo, age, marital status, or nationality
cvWriting.content11: Tailor your CV for each job application
cvWriting.content12: Use action verbs: managed, developed, achieved, implemented
cvWriting.content15: Save as PDF to preserve formatting
cvWriting.content17: Include references or state 'Available on request'
cvWriting.content19: Get someone to proofread before sending
cvWriting.tip1: Use LinkedIn to research UK CV formats
cvWriting.tip2: Keep it simple - avoid fancy designs unless in creative field
cvWriting.tip3: Focus on achievements, not just duties
cvWriting.tip4: Use keywords from the job description
cvWriting.tip5: Consider using a free CV builder like Canva

jobSearch.title: Job Search
jobSearch.content1: Popular UK job sites: Indeed, Reed, LinkedIn, Totaljobs, CV-Library
jobSearch.content2: Set up job alerts to get notified of new opportunities
jobSearch.content3: Create profiles on multiple job sites
jobSearch.content4: Use recruitment agencies - they're free for job seekers
jobSearch.content5: Network on LinkedIn - connect with people in your industry
jobSearch.content6: Check company websites directly for vacancies
jobSearch.content7: Attend job fairs and networking events
jobSearch.content8: Consider temp agencies for quick employment
jobSearch.content10: Sign up with the Jobcentre if unemployed
jobSearch.content11: Look for 'Skilled Worker visa sponsorship' if you need it
jobSearch.content12: Research average salaries for your role
jobSearch.content13: Consider location - London pays more but costs more
jobSearch.content14: Apply to many jobs - it's a numbers game
jobSearch.content15: Keep track of applications in a spreadsheet
jobSearch.tip1: Apply within 48 hours of a job posting
jobSearch.tip2: Customize your cover letter for each application
jobSearch.tip3: Follow up after 1-2 weeks if no response
jobSearch.tip5: Use your network - many jobs are filled through referrals

interviews.title: Job Interviews
interviews.content1: Research the company thoroughly before the interview
interviews.content3: Use the STAR method: Situation, Task, Action, Result
interviews.content4: Prepare questions to ask the interviewer
interviews.content5: Dress professionally - when in doubt, overdress
interviews.content10: Listen carefully to questions before answering
interviews.content13: Send a thank-you email within 24 hours
interviews.content14: For video interviews: test technology beforehand
interviews.content15: Ensure good lighting and quiet background
interviews.content16: Dress professionally even for video calls
interviews.content17: Look at the camera, not the screen
interviews.content18: Have notes nearby but don't read from them
interviews.tip1: Practice with a friend or family member
interviews.tip4: Research typical interview questions for your industry
interviews.tip6: Ask about next steps at the end of the interview

rights.title: Worker Rights
rights.content1: Minimum wage (2024): Â£11.44/hour for 21+, lower for younger workers
rights.content2: Maximum working week: 48 hours (you can opt out)
rights.content4: Paid holiday: 28 days per year including bank holidays
rights.content5: Sick pay: Statutory Sick Pay if you earn over Â£123/week
rights.content8: You must have a written employment contract
rights.content9: You have the right to payslips
rights.content10: Employers cannot discriminate based on protected characteristics
rights.content11: You can join a trade union
rights.content12: You have the right to safe working conditions
rights.content13: Notice period depends on length of employment
rights.content15: You can request flexible working after 26 weeks
rights.content16: Pension: auto-enrollment if you earn over Â£10,000/year
rights.tip1: Keep copies of your employment contract
rights.tip3: Know your rights before starting a job
rights.tip4: Contact ACAS for workplace dispute advice
rights.tip5: Join a union for additional protection

findingAccommodation.title: Finding Accommodation
findingAccommodation.content1: Main websites: Rightmove, Zoopla, SpareRoom, OpenRent
findingAccommodation.content2: Types: flat, house, room in shared house, studio
findingAccommodation.content3: Consider location carefully - commute time and costs
findingAccommodation.content4: Check transport links (Underground, bus routes, trains)
findingAccommodation.content5: Research the area (crime rates, amenities, schools)
findingAccommodation.content6: View properties in person when possible
findingAccommodation.content7: Check for damp, heating quality, and water pressure
findingAccommodation.content10: Understand the difference between furnished and unfurnished
findingAccommodation.content11: Ask about the deposit amount (usually 5 weeks rent)
findingAccommodation.content12: Deposit must be in a government protection scheme
findingAccommodation.content13: Check the EPC (Energy Performance Certificate) rating
findingAccommodation.content14: Ask about internet availability and speed
findingAccommodation.content15: Check parking options if you have a car
findingAccommodation.content16: Read the tenancy agreement carefully before signing
findingAccommodation.content17: Take photos of the property before moving in
findingAccommodation.content19: Use estate agents or landlords directly
findingAccommodation.warning1: Never pay before viewing the property
findingAccommodation.warning2: Be wary of deals that seem too good to be true
findingAccommodation.warning3: Never send money abroad for UK property

rentalCosts.title: Rental Costs
rentalCosts.content6: Council Tax: Â£100-300/month depending on area
rentalCosts.content10: TV Licence: Â£159/year (required if watching live TV)
rentalCosts.content14: Check if there are any admin fees (now limited by law)
rentalCosts.content15: Ask about rent increases during tenancy
rentalCosts.content16: Understand break clauses in the contract
rentalCosts.content18: Consider costs of furnishing if unfurnished
rentalCosts.warning1: Have emergency fund for unexpected costs
rentalCosts.warning2: Rent arrears can affect your credit score
rentalCosts.warning3: Budget for agency fees if applicable

tenantRights.title: Tenant Rights
tenantRights.content1: Your deposit must be in a protection scheme
tenantRights.content2: Landlord must provide Gas Safety Certificate
tenantRights.content4: Working smoke and carbon monoxide alarms required
tenantRights.content5: Right to quiet enjoyment - landlord must give 24h notice to visit
tenantRights.content7: Landlord responsible for heating and hot water systems
tenantRights.content8: You have rights even without a written contract
tenantRights.content9: Illegal eviction is a criminal offence
tenantRights.content10: Landlord cannot harass you to leave
tenantRights.content11: You can request repairs in writing
tenantRights.content12: If repairs not done, contact local council
tenantRights.content13: Minimum notice period to end tenancy: usually 1-2 months
tenantRights.content15: Section 8 notice: varies depending on reason
tenantRights.content16: You can challenge unfair eviction in court
tenantRights.content17: Keep records of all communication with landlord
tenantRights.content19: Citizens Advice can help with housing issues
tenantRights.warning1: Document everything with photos and in writing
tenantRights.warning3: Get legal advice if facing eviction

billsUtilities.title: Bills & Utilities
billsUtilities.content1: Electricity: Choose from many providers - use comparison sites
billsUtilities.content2: Gas: Often bundled with electricity (dual fuel)
billsUtilities.content3: Water: You cannot choose your provider - it's based on area
billsUtilities.content4: Internet: Compare deals at BroadbandChoices or Uswitch
billsUtilities.content5: Mobile: Pay-as-you-go or contract options available
billsUtilities.content6: TV Licence: Required for watching live TV or BBC iPlayer
billsUtilities.content7: Council Tax: Contact your local council to set up
billsUtilities.content8: Comparison sites: Uswitch, MoneySupermarket, Compare the Market
billsUtilities.content9: Consider fixed-rate tariffs for budget certainty
billsUtilities.content10: Set up direct debit for discounts
billsUtilities.content11: Submit regular meter readings to avoid estimated bills
billsUtilities.content12: Consider smart meters for accurate billing
billsUtilities.content13: Energy saving: Turn off lights, lower thermostat, draught-proof
billsUtilities.content14: Water saving: Fix leaks, take shorter showers
billsUtilities.content15: Ask about warm home discount if on low income
billsUtilities.content16: Winter fuel payment available for pensioners
billsUtilities.content17: Some areas have social tariffs for low-income households
billsUtilities.content18: Budget billing spreads costs evenly throughout year
billsUtilities.content19: Check standing charges as well as unit rates
billsUtilities.content20: Energy price cap protects against extreme prices
billsUtilities.content21: Switch providers when fixed deal ends
billsUtilities.content22: Keep provider contact details handy for emergencies
billsUtilities.content23: Know where your stopcock and fuse box are

universalCredit.title: Universal Credit
universalCredit.content1: Universal Credit is the main benefit for working-age people
universalCredit.content2: It combines 6 previous benefits into one monthly payment
universalCredit.content3: Replaces: Income Support, JSA, ESA, Housing Benefit, Child Tax Credit, Working Tax Credit
universalCredit.content4: Paid monthly into your bank account
universalCredit.content8: Additional amounts for children, housing, disability, carers
universalCredit.content9: You can work and still receive Universal Credit
universalCredit.content10: Work allowance before UC is reduced: Â£379/month (no housing element)
universalCredit.content12: Taper rate: UC reduces by 55p for each Â£1 earned above allowance
universalCredit.content14: You'll need to verify your identity
universalCredit.content18: Advance payments available if you need money immediately
universalCredit.content19: Report any changes in circumstances immediately
universalCredit.eligibility4: Have less than Â£16,000 in savings
universalCredit.eligibility5: Have the right to work and claim benefits in the UK

childBenefit.title: Child Benefit
childBenefit.content1: Available to anyone responsible for a child under 16
childBenefit.content2: Or under 20 if in approved education/training
childBenefit.content5: Paid every 4 weeks or weekly if you're a single parent
childBenefit.content6: Not means-tested - available regardless of income
childBenefit.content7: However, high earners may have to pay some back as tax
childBenefit.content8: High Income Child Benefit Charge applies if you earn over Â£60,000
childBenefit.content9: Apply online at GOV.UK or by post
childBenefit.content10: You'll need your child's birth/adoption certificate
childBenefit.content12: Payments are backdated up to 3 months
childBenefit.content13: Still claim even if you don't want the money - protects pension
childBenefit.content14: Claiming counts towards National Insurance credits
childBenefit.content15: Update your claim when child starts school/college
childBenefit.eligibility1: Anyone responsible for a child under 16 (or under 20 in education)
childBenefit.eligibility3: Only one person can claim per child

jobseekers.title: Jobseeker's Allowance
jobseekers.content1: JSA is being replaced by Universal Credit but still exists in some cases
jobseekers.content3: Contribution-based: Based on National Insurance contributions
jobseekers.content4: Income-based: Now mostly replaced by Universal Credit
jobseekers.content6: Must be available to start work
jobseekers.content7: Must be aged 18 or over (some 16-17 exceptions)
jobseekers.content8: Must not be in full-time education
jobseekers.content9: Must work less than 16 hours a week
jobseekers.content16: Must sign agreement about job searching
jobseekers.content17: Benefits can be stopped (sanctioned) if you don't comply
jobseekers.content18: Consider Universal Credit instead for most situations

freeServices.title: Free Services & Support
freeServices.content2: GP appointments: Free for everyone registered
freeServices.content3: Hospital treatment: Free for emergency care
freeServices.content4: Prescriptions: Free in Scotland, Wales, NI; Â£9.90 in England
freeServices.content5: Free prescriptions if: pregnant, over 60, on low income benefits
freeServices.content6: Dental: NHS rates (not free, but cheaper than private)
freeServices.content7: Eye tests: Free for some groups (children, over 60, on benefits)
freeServices.content9: State schools: Free for all children 5-18
freeServices.content10: Free school meals: If on certain benefits
freeServices.content11: Free childcare: 15-30 hours for 3-4 year olds
freeServices.content12: 2 year old childcare: Free if on benefits
freeServices.content13: ESOL classes: Often free at local colleges
freeServices.content14: Public libraries: Free membership and book borrowing
freeServices.content16: Housing Benefit/UC Housing Element: Help with rent
freeServices.content17: Council housing: Apply through local council
freeServices.content19: Citizens Advice: Free advice on housing rights
freeServices.content21: Bus pass: Free for over 60s and disabled
freeServices.content22: Railcard discounts: For families, seniors, disabled
freeServices.content25: Healthy Start: Free vitamins and food vouchers for pregnant women
freeServices.content26: Free school breakfast clubs: Many schools offer this
freeServices.content28: Citizens Advice: Free advice on many topics
freeServices.content30: Law Centres: Free legal advice for those who can't afford solicitors

schoolSystem.title: UK School System
schoolSystem.content1: Education is compulsory from age 5 to 18
schoolSystem.content6: Reception: Age 4-5, first year of primary
schoolSystem.content7: Free childcare: 15-30 hours for 3-4 year olds
schoolSystem.content12: SATs tests in Year 2 and Year 6
schoolSystem.content23: State schools, Academy schools, Grammar schools (selective), Faith schools, Private schools

schoolApplication.title: Applying for Schools
schoolApplication.content1: Apply through your local council website
schoolApplication.content2: Deadline for primary: Usually January for September start
schoolApplication.content3: Deadline for secondary: Usually October for September start
schoolApplication.content4: You can list 3-6 preferences (varies by area)
schoolApplication.content5: Admission criteria varies: Distance, siblings, faith, ability
schoolApplication.content10: Proof of address (utility bill, tenancy agreement)
schoolApplication.content15: Contact local council for in-year admissions
schoolApplication.content16: School may assess your child's level
schoolApplication.content17: EAL (English as Additional Language) support available
schoolApplication.content18: Free school meals application may be needed
schoolApplication.content21: Results usually sent in April (primary) or March (secondary)
schoolApplication.content22: Accept your place within the deadline given
schoolApplication.content23: You can stay on waiting lists for preferred schools
schoolApplication.content24: Home schooling is legal but you must notify the council
schoolApplication.tip1: Apply on time - late applications go to the bottom of the list
schoolApplication.tip2: Research schools thoroughly before listing preferences
schoolApplication.tip3: Consider realistic options based on distance and criteria
schoolApplication.tip4: Keep copies of all documents submitted
schoolApplication.tip5: Contact the school directly if you have questions

englishClasses.title: English Classes (ESOL)
englishClasses.content1: ESOL = English for Speakers of Other Languages
englishClasses.content2: Available at local colleges, adult education centres, charities
englishClasses.content3: Many courses are FREE if you meet criteria
englishClasses.content4: Free if: On certain benefits, earning under Â£25,000, aged 16-19
englishClasses.content10: English for citizenship: Prepare for Life in UK test
englishClasses.content14: Adult education centres: Check your council website
englishClasses.content18: BBC Learning English: Free videos and exercises
englishClasses.content19: British Council Learn English: Comprehensive resources
englishClasses.content20: Duolingo: Free app for language learning
englishClasses.content24: Evidence of benefits if claiming free course
englishClasses.content26: Assessment test usually required to determine level

higherEducation.title: Higher Education
higherEducation.content1: Universities in the UK offer degrees and professional qualifications
higherEducation.content11: Tuition fee loan: Covers fees, repay after earning over Â£27,295
higherEducation.tip2: Apply for student finance as early as possible
higherEducation.tip5: Attend open days to visit campuses

moderation.title: Moderation
moderation.noAccess: You don't have permission to access this page
moderation.banReasonPlaceholder: Enter reason for banning this user
moderation.confirmApproveDescription: This will reset the report count and make the service active again.
moderation.confirmSuspendDescription: This will suspend the service and remove it from public listings.
moderation.confirmDeleteDescription: This will permanently delete the service. This action cannot be undone.
moderation.confirmBanOwnerDescription: This will ban the owner and suspend all their services. This action is serious.

report.reportDescription: Please select a reason for reporting this service. Reports are reviewed by our moderation team.
report.alreadyReported: You have already reported this service
report.alreadyReportedMessage: You already reported this service. Your report is under review.
report.signInRequired: Please sign in to report a service
